verses.verse: "You shall not see <WH7200> your countryman <WH251>'s ox <WH7794> or <WH176> his sheep <WH7716> straying <WH5080> away, <WH5080> and pay <WH5956> no <WH5956> attention <WH5956> to them; you shall certainly <WH7725> bring <WH7725> them back <WH7725> to your countryman.

"And if <WH518> your countryman <WH251> is not near <WH7138> you, or if you do not know <WH3045> him, then you shall bring <WH622> it home <WH8432> to your house, <WH1004> and it shall remain <WH1961> with you until <WH5704> your countryman <WH251> looks <WH1875> for it; then you shall restore <WH7725> it to him.

"And thus <WH3651> you shall do <WH6213> with his donkey, <WH2543> and you shall do <WH6213> the same <WH3651> with his garment, <WH8071> and you shall do <WH6213> likewise <WH3651> with anything <WH3605> lost by your countryman, <WH9> which <WH251> he has lost and you have found. <WH834> You are not allowed <WH6> to neglect <WH4672> [them.]

"You shall not see <WH7200> your countryman's donkey <WH2543> or <WH176> his ox <WH7794> fallen <WH5307> down <WH5307> on the way, <WH1870> and pay <WH5956> no <WH5956> attention <WH5956> to them; you shall certainly <WH6965> help <WH6965> him to raise <WH6965> [them] up.

"A woman <WH802> shall not wear <WH1961> <WH5921> man <WH1397>'s clothing, <WH3627> nor <WH3808> shall a man put <WH3847> on a woman's clothing; <WH8071> for whoever <WH3605> does <WH6213> these <WH428> things <WH428> is an abomination <WH8441> to the Lord <WH3068> your God. <WH430>

"If <WH3588> you happen <WH7122> to come <WH7122> upon a bird's nest <WH7064> along the way, <WH1870> in any <WH3605> tree <WH6086> or <WH176> on the ground, <WH776> with young <WH667> ones <WH667> or <WH176> eggs, <WH1000> and the mother <WH517> sitting <WH7257> on the young <WH667> or <WH176> on the eggs, <WH1000> you shall not take <WH3947> the mother <WH517> with the young; <WH1121>

you shall certainly <WH7971> let <WH7971> the mother <WH517> go, <WH7971> but the young <WH1121> you may take <WH3947> for yourself, in order <WH4616> that it may be well <WH3190> with you, and that you may prolong <WH748> your days. <WH3117>

"When <WH3588> you build <WH1129> a new <WH2319> house, <WH1004> you shall make <WH6213> a parapet <WH4624> for your roof, <WH1406> that you may not bring <WH7760> bloodguilt <WH1818> on your house <WH1004> if <WH3588> anyone <WH5307> falls <WH5307> from it.

"You shall not sow <WH2232> your vineyard <WH3754> with two <WH3610> kinds <WH3610> of seed, lest <WH6435> all <WH4395> the produce <WH4395> of the seed <WH2233> which <WH834> you have sown, <WH2232> and the increase <WH8393> of the vineyard <WH3754> become <WH6942> defiled. <WH6942>
"You shall not plow <WH9177> with an ox <WH7794> and a donkey <WH2543> together. <WH9191>
"You shall not wear <WH3847> a material <WH8162> mixed <WH8162> of wool <WH6785> and linen <WH6593> together. <WH9191>
"You shall make <WH6213> yourself tassels <WH1434> on the four <WH702> corners <WH3671> of your garment <WH3682> with which <WH834> you cover <WH3680> yourself.
"If <WH3588> any <WH376> man <WH376> takes <WH3947> a wife <WH802> and goes <WH935> in to her and [then] turns <WH8130> against <WH8130> her,

and charges <WH7760> her with shameful <WH5949> deeds <WH1697> and publicly <WH3318> defames <WH8034> <WH7451> <WH3318> her, and says, <WH559> 'I took <WH3947> this <WH2088> woman, <WH802> [but] when I came <WH7126> near <WH7126> her, I did not find <WH4672> her a virgin, <WH1331>'
then the girl's father and her mother <WH1> shall take <WH517> and bring <WH3947> out the [evidence] of the girl's virginity <WH3318> to the elders <WH1331> of the city <WH2205> at the gate. <WH5892>
"And the girl's father shall say <WH1> to the elders, <WH559> 'I gave <WH2205> my daughter <WH5414> to this <WH1323> man <WH2088> for a wife, <WH376> but he turned <WH802> against <WH8130> her;

and behold, <WH2009> he has charged <WH7760> her with shameful <WH5949> deeds, <WH1697> saying, <WH559> "I did not find <WH4672> your daughter <WH1323> a virgin. <WH1331>" But this <WH428> is the [evidence] of my daughter's virginity. <WH1331>' And they shall spread <WH6566> the garment <WH8071> before <WH6440> the elders <WH2205> of the city. <WH5892>
"So the elders <WH2205> of that city <WH5892> shall take <WH3947> the man <WH376> and chastise <WH3256> him,

and they shall fine <WH6064> him a hundred <WH3967> [shekels] of silver <WH3701> and give <WH5414> it to the girl's father, because <WH1> he publicly <WH3588> defamed <WH3318> <WH8034> <WH7451> a virgin <WH3318> of Israel. <WH1330> And she shall remain <WH3478> his wife; <WH1961> he cannot <WH802> <WH3201> divorce <WH3808> her all <WH7971> his days. <WH3605>
"But if <WH518> this <WH2088> charge <WH1697> is true, <WH571> that the girl <WH5291> was not found <WH4672> a virgin, <WH1331>

then they shall bring <WH3318> out the girl <WH5291> to the doorway <WH6607> of her father's house, <WH1004> and the men <WH376> of her city <WH5892> shall stone <WH5619> her to death <WH4191> because <WH3588> she has committed <WH6213> an act <WH5039> of folly <WH5039> in Israel, <WH3478> by playing <WH2181> the harlot <WH2181> in her father's house; <WH1004> thus you shall purge <WH1197> the evil <WH9563> from among <WH7130> you.

"If <WH3588> a man <WH376> is found <WH4672> lying <WH7901> with a married <WH1166> <WH1167> woman, <WH802> then both <WH1571> <WH8147> of them shall die, <WH4191> the man <WH376> who lay <WH7901> with the woman, <WH802> and the woman; <WH802> thus you shall purge <WH1197> the evil <WH9563> from Israel. <WH3478>
"If <WH3588> there is a girl <WH5291> who is a virgin <WH1330> engaged <WH781> to a man, <WH376> and [another] man <WH376> finds <WH4672> her in the city <WH5892> and lies <WH7901> with her,

then you shall bring <WH3318> them both <WH8147> out to the gate <WH8179> of that city <WH5892> and you shall stone <WH5619> them to death; <WH4191> the girl, <WH5291> because <WH5921> <WH1697> <WH834> she did not cry <WH6817> out in the city, <WH5892> and the man, <WH376> because <WH5921> <WH1697> <WH834> he has violated <WH6031> his neighbor's wife. <WH802> Thus you shall purge <WH1197> the evil <WH9563> from among <WH7130> you.

"But if <WH518> in the field <WH7704> the man <WH376> finds <WH4672> the girl <WH5291> who is engaged, <WH781> and the man <WH376> forces <WH2388> her and lies <WH7901> with her, then only <WH905> the man <WH376> who <WH834> lies <WH7901> with her shall die. <WH4191>

"But you shall do <WH6213> nothing <WH3808> <WH1697> to the girl; <WH5291> there <WH369> is no <WH369> sin <WH2399> in the girl <WH5291> worthy of death, <WH4194> for just <WH3152> as a man <WH376> rises <WH6965> against <WH5921> his neighbor <WH7453> and murders <WH7523> him, so <WH3651> is this <WH2088> case. <WH1697>
"When <WH3588> he found <WH4672> her in the field, <WH7704> the engaged <WH781> girl <WH5291> cried <WH6817> out, but there <WH369> was no <WH369> one to save <WH3467> her.

"If <WH3588> a man <WH376> finds <WH4672> a girl <WH5291> who is a virgin, <WH1330> who <WH834> is not engaged, <WH781> and seizes <WH8610> her and lies <WH7901> with her and they are discovered, <WH4672>

then the man <WH376> who lay <WH7901> with her shall give <WH5414> to the girl's father fifty <WH1> [shekels] of silver, <WH2572> and she shall become <WH3701> his wife <WH1961> because <WH802> <WH8478> he has violated <WH834> her; he cannot <WH6031> <WH3201> divorce <WH3808> her all <WH7971> his days. <WH3605>
"A man <WH376> shall not take <WH3947> his father's wife <WH802> so that he shall not uncover <WH1540> his father's skirt. <WH3671>
